p: Dengue fever (DF) is a widespread vector-borne viral infectious disease which has a rapidly increase in infections, geographic distribution, and the severity cases[ 1]. The rapidly expanding global footprint of DF has evolved to a major public health problem due to increased geographical extension, climate changes, population growth and global travel in the last 50 years [ 2]. DF is endemic and has been reported in more than 100 countries including the southeast Asia, the Americas, the western Pacific, Africa [ 3]. 3.9 billion people are at the potential risk of DF in these endemic regions [ 4]. The high economic burden brought could not been neglected [ 5].
